body.p:
Now that you've learned the basics, explore Smalltalk in more depth:
Explore the ∏ documentation. At the least, read the Walk Through, look at the ∏ Application Developer's Guide, and the GUI Developer's Guide.
Read some of the code in the class library (but remember that although the code in the image is very instructive, it is not always perfect).
Create applications with your own classes.
Learn about Extreme Programming (XP).

When studying source code in the Browser, consider the following:
Take advantage of package names. If you want to know about collections, then a good place to start is to browse packages in the Collections bundle.
Learn about implementors-of, senders-of, references-to, and other relationships and examples. Use the options on the Browse menu in the Launcher and similar commands in the Browser itself.
Read class comments, and look at the class side for examples and documentation protocols. Examples are also sometimes included as comments, as in the Dialog class methods.
Find a more experienced Smalltalker or study with a fellow student.
Explore some of the resources listed in the References section, at the end of this introduction.
